abstract: Will plenty of mismanaged companies, the return of activist investors, like Carl C. Icahn and William A. Ackman, looks likely, Reuters Breakingviews says.
snippet: Will plenty of mismanaged companies, the return of activist investors, like Carl C. Icahn and William A. Ackman, looks likely, Reuters Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Activist shareholders are back — and for good reason, Reuters Breakingviews says. As the proxy season heats up, pot-stirrers like Carl C. Icahn and Ron Burkle are raising a fuss at companies like Genzyme and Barnes & Noble. Easy pickings from the credit bubble’s bursting may be gone. But the activists remain a formidable bunch.
